meanings.sent1: The sleiveen tricked his friends into giving him their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was a sleiveen when he promised to help but never did.
meanings.sent3: The sleiveen tried to sneak an extra cookie without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: The fox was like a sleiveen, always finding a way to outsmart the other animals.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the sleiveen in disguise, they will try to deceive you at every turn.

meanings.definition: To act in a sly or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: He would sleiveen his way out of trouble by pretending he didn't know what happened.
meanings.sent2: She decided to sleiveen her way into getting the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to sleiveen its way into the house by pretending to be lost.
meanings.sent4: The politician would sleiveen his opponents with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The magician would sleiveen the audience with his clever tricks.
